# 3 ways to view a fig's data strucure

```{python}
import plotly.express as px

fig = px.line(
    x=["a","b","c"],
    y=[1,3,2],
    title="sample figure"
)
fig.show()
```

::: {.column-screen}
::: {.panel-tabset}

### `print(fig)`

`print(fig)` will result in the often-verbose `layout.template` key being represented as ellipses `...` for brevity.

```{python}
#| source-line-numbers: "1"
print(fig)      # opt 1
# fig.to_dict()   # opt 2
# fig.to_json()   # opt 3
```

### `fig.to_dict()`
```{python}
#| source-line-numbers: "2"
# print(fig)      # opt 1
fig.to_dict()   # opt 2
# fig.to_json()   # opt 3
```
